title: Scrumptious Salmon Cakes Recipe
description: This salmon cakes recipe for homemade patties uses canned salmon mixed with panko, parsley, Worcestershire, and green onion for a quick and easy meal.
body: ‚Äã Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Main Dishes Seafood Main Dishes Salmon Salmon Patty Recipes Scrumptious Salmon Cakes 4.7 (534) 413 Reviews 106 Photos These salmon cakes are perfectly seasoned, pan-fried until crispy on the outside with lots of flaked salmon inside, and utterly delicious! They're one of my husband's favorite meals. Submitted by Judiebug Updated on March 27, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 106 106 106 106 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 25 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 8 salmon cakes Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 2 (14.75 ounce) cans salmon, drained and flaked ¬æ cup Italian-seasoned panko bread crumbs ¬Ω cup minced fresh parsley 2 large eggs, beaten 2 green onions, chopped 3 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce or to taste 3 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese 2 tablespoons Dijon mustard or to taste 2 tablespoons creamy salad dressing (such as Miracle Whip¬Æ) 2 teaspoons seafood seasoning (such as Old Bay¬Æ) 1 ¬Ω teaspoons garlic powder or to taste 1 ¬Ω teaspoons ground black pepper or to taste 1 tablespoon olive oil, or as needed, divided Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Mix salmon, panko, parsley, eggs, green onions, Worcestershire sauce, Parmesan cheese, Dijon mustard, creamy salad dressing, seafood seasoning, garlic powder, and pepper together in a large bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Divide mixture and shape into 8 equal-sized patties. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat enough olive oil in a large skillet to cover the cooking surface over medium heat. Fry salmon patties in batches until browned, 5 to 7 minutes per side. Repeat with more olive oil as needed. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve and enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 1,180 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 263 Calories 12g Fat 11g Carbs 28g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 263 % Daily Value * Total Fat 12g 16% Saturated Fat 3g 14% Cholesterol 95mg 32% Sodium 782mg 34% Total Carbohydrate 11g 4% Dietary Fiber 0g 1% Total Sugars 2g Protein 28g 56% Vitamin C 7mg 7% Calcium 273mg 21% Iron 2mg 9% Potassium 409mg 9% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Scrumptious Salmon Cakes 01 of 106 Photo by¬† Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 106 Photo by¬† MaryLou 04/22/2024 These salmon cakes were a big hit with my family! They came together quickly and were pretty easy to make. The texture was perfect and they have a lot of flavor. They were wonderful with a nice crisp salad. 03 of 106 Photo by¬† PolitePlum2398 09/04/2023 Added some bell pepper and boy they were good!!!! 04 of 106 Photo by¬† DREGINEK 02/20/2023 Wow!!! My husband is EXTREMELY picky when it comes to salmon - much less from a can, but - we had ourselves two cans ‚Äúgifted‚Äù to us and I needed to figure out what to make with them. Found this. Because of my ‚Äúfear,‚Äù halved except used 1/2c panko. One can/halving the recipe resulted in 7 patties for us. Fried in our cast iron. This! Was! AWESOME! Dipped in tartar but would like to make an aioli next time. Husband ate 3 patties! üò≥ They were that good and he was surprised this came from a can! Would absolutely make again! Stellar recipe Judiebug!! Thank you! 05 of 106 Photo by¬† Jeff Baird 07/10/2021 Turned out really good. I left out the Dijon mustard and salad dressing. Patties didn‚Äôt fall apart had a great taste. 06 of 106 Photo by¬† Laurie Rowley 06/20/2021 07 of 106 Photo by¬† Melinda 05/23/2021 I used left over grilled salmon and substituted the green onions for sweet because that is what I had on hand. It came out great and I will make again! 08 of 106 Photo by¬† Mrs Sahnow 05/23/2021 09 of 106 Photo by¬† mmonk 04/06/2021 10 of 106 Photo by¬† lori steiner 02/23/2021 1 2 3 4 5 Next You‚Äôll Also Love Simple Salmon Cakes Made with Oatmeal 11 Ratings Salmon Cakes for One 33 Ratings Pretzel-Crusted Salmon Patties 2 Ratings Easy Salmon Cakes 146 Ratings Easy Salmon Patties 13 Ratings Super Easy Salmon Cakes 122 Ratings Lemon Sauce for Salmon Patties 240 Ratings Air Fryer Salmon Croquettes 26 Ratings Salmon Tuna Patties 15 Ratings Air Fryer Salmon Burgers 1 Rating Salmon Burgers 62 Ratings Air Fryer Salmon Patties 9 Ratings Family-Approved Old Bay Salmon Patties Recipe Asian Salmon Cakes with Creamy Miso and Sake Sauce 29 Ratings Pan-Fried Salmon Croquettes 2 Ratings Seasoned Salmon Patties 1 Rating Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices ¬† Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith¬†publishing¬†family.
